poem:
**A New Dawn**

The Commons sways  
like a canvas in dawn's first light.  
Labour breathes, promises spill  
into the streets, veining  
the tired, the worn.  
Starmer's voice is a bell,  
ringing out reform,  
mending cracks—  
a nation's heartbeat  
echoes in the corridors  
once filled  
with shadows.
prompt: You are the poet William Carlos Williams. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "Starmer tells his cabinet: now it’s time to deliver on our promises Keir Starmer on Saturday rallied his new cabinet behind an ambitious agenda to reform the country’s creaking public services and reset damaged relations abroad during his first full day as prime minister. After an extraordinary 48 hours that saw Labour storm to a landslide general election victory with a massive Commons majority of 174 while the Tories were routed, Starmer said he was". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
